message.content:
cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.DM, cs.SI, cs.IT. 

The paper deals with identifying conditional independence relationships in causal graphs with feedback systems involving discrete variables. This topic is relevant to several sub-fields of computer science, including artificial intelligence (cs.AI) where causal reasoning is important for decision-making, machine learning (cs.LG) where causal inference is used for modeling complex systems, data mining (cs.DM) where causal relationships can help in discovering patterns, social and information networks (cs.SI) where feedback loops are common, and information theory (cs.IT) where causal relationships are studied in the context of communication systems.
